articles.title: Rugby-Springboks overcome scrappy first half to beat Argentina 24-13
articles.description: South Africa's forward power was evident in the scrum and they were much more clinical after halftime, lowering their error count and forcing Argentina in mistakes through pressure. The home side were first to go over the line through Bertranou when he took a quick tap-penalty following a succession of infringements by the Boks in their own 22.
articles.content:
Tries by wings Makazole Mapimpi and Canan Moodie helped a much-changed South Africa to a 24-13 victory over Argentina in their Rugby World Cup warm-up clash in Buenos Aires on Saturday, ruining a major milestone for home hooker Agustin Creevy.

articles.title: Canadians Draxl and Martin drop opening matches at NBO Toronto qualifying
articles.description: Canada's Liam Draxl dropped a 7-6 (6), 6-4 decision to Argentina's Diego Schwartzman in first-round qualifying play at the National Bank Open on Saturday.
articles.content:
The Canadian Press
Canada's Liam Draxl dropped a 7-6 (6), 6-4 decision to Argentina's Diego Schwartzman in first-round qualifying play at the National Bank Open on Saturday.
